sense.name: recant or renege on a belief or agreement
sense.examples: Bush administration has resiled from some international treaties. India has resiled from its UN obligations. There is a tendency to resile from the old theory of chance. I do not resile from a single word I have written about the bank's collapse. Mr Miliband does not resile from his vote for the war. The government would not resile from it's commitment.

sense.name: spring back to original shape
sense.examples: The rubber tubes resiled. These particles do not resile but they unite after they collide.
